definition: to appoint
same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
surname Wei
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: The Premier deputed the Foreign Minister to act as his deputy.
sentences.chinese: 總理委派外交部長作爲他的代表。

sentences.english: Finally, delegating logic often leads to a cleaner separation of concerns.
sentences.chinese: 最後，委派邏輯通常會得到更乾淨的關注點分離。

sentences.english: Norman and I were deputed for the unpleasant task.
sentences.chinese: 我和諾曼被委派去幹這件苦差事。

sentences.english: Paul had assigned Timothy to carry out special duties at the church in Ephesus.
sentences.chinese: 保羅曾委派提摩太在以弗所教會中承擔特別的事工。

sentences.english: Accounting centralized assessing system is one of the common practice of accounting designating system.
sentences.chinese: 會計集中核算制是會計委派制的一種常用方式。

sentences.english: We must appoint a new teacher at once to the mountain school.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須立即委派一名新教師到那山村小學去。

sentences.english: If the master goes down, another server is delegated as master.
sentences.chinese: 如果主進程停掉，則委派其他服務器作爲主進程。

sentences.english: The system of appointing accountants is an attempt to manage accountants in China.
sentences.chinese: 會計委派制是對會計人員管理體制進行的一種嘗試。

sentences.english: The master-administrator determines which roles are delegated to the sub-administrator.
sentences.chinese: 主管理員決定將那種角色委派給次級管理員。

sentences.english: So, company burning gas also won't accreditation or precatory.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，燃氣公司亦不會委派或委託的。

sentences.english: Li Hongzhang was appointed to approach the imperialists and sue for peace.
sentences.chinese: 李鴻章被委派向帝國主義求和。

sentences.english: Delegates can be used to define callback methods.
sentences.chinese: 委派可用於定義回呼方法。

sentences.english: I repair, then, fellow-citizens, to the post you have assigned me.
sentences.chinese: 各位公民，我即將擔當起你們委派給我的職務。

sentences.english: He was gazetted to a new regiment.
Fishery officials have started sending instructors to schools.
sentences.chinese: 漁業官員已經開始委派指導員到學校。

sentences.english: This Agreement and all its provisions shall be binding upon and endure to the benefit of the successors and assigns of the respective parties hereto.
sentences.chinese: 本協議及有的條款對繼承人和委派的代表都有約束力。

definition: to assign/to appoint/assignment
to appoint
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
to appoint/(job) appointment/CL:紙|纸[zhi3]
to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity/to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
to select/to detail/to set apart/to appoint
to give orders
to send (on a mission)/to dispatch
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
full powers/total authority/plenipotentiary powers
ordained or appointed to a post/to benefit from counsel
a plenipotentiary (representative)
special appointment/special correspondent/task force/sb dispatched on a mission
to appoint and dismiss
to fill a post/to act as
